social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Dr. Ambedkar Centrally Sponsored Scheme of Post-Matric Scholarships for the Economically Backward Class (EBC) Students
social_welfare_schemes.ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
social_welfare_schemes.department: Department of Social Justice and Empowerment
objectives: Provide financial assistance to Economically Backward Class (EBC) students
Enable EBC students to complete post-matriculation or post-secondary education

benefits.scholarship: Financial assistance for tuition fees, maintenance allowance, and other expenses, disbursed directly to student’s bank account via DBT

eligibility_criteria: Pursuing post-matriculation or post-secondary education in recognized institutions in India
Family income not exceeding ₹2,50,000 per annum
Not availing benefits of any other scholarship scheme
exclusions: Students pursuing courses through open universities

steps: Visit the National Scholarship Portal at https://scholarships.gov.in/
Register and fill personal and academic details
Submit application and note application ID
Verification by educational institution and scholarship authorities

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Jeevanam Self-Employment Scheme To Dependents Of Crime Victims
objectives: Provide financial assistance for self-employment to dependents of crime victims
Support economic independence for affected families

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to ₹1,00,000 for starting self-employment ventures, disbursed directly to applicant’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Dependent of a crime victim (spouse, child, or parent)
Breadwinner of the family affected by crime
exclusions: Applicants not directly dependent on crime victim

steps: Obtain application form from Department of Social Justice office or website
Fill personal details and proposed venture details
Submit application with required documents to local Social Justice office

documents_required: Proof of residence (e.g., ration card, voter ID)
Document proving dependency on crime victim (e.g., FIR, death certificate)
Business plan for proposed self-employment venture

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Coaching Schemes For SC/ST/OBC (Non-Creamy Layer) & Minority Students For Universities
objectives: Provide coaching to SC/ST/OBC (non-creamy layer) and minority students
Support preparation for university entrance examinations

benefits.coaching: Free or subsidized coaching for entrance exams, disbursed directly to empanelled coaching institutes

eligibility_criteria: Belong to SC, ST, OBC (non-creamy layer), or minority communities
Family income not exceeding ₹6,00,000 per annum for OBC
exclusions: Students not belonging to eligible communities
Family income exceeding ₹6,00,000 per annum for OBC
Students not enrolled in empanelled institutes

steps: Apply through empanelled coaching institutes or Ministry portal at https://minorityaffairs.gov.in/
Selection based on merit or need by coaching institute

documents_required: Proof of enrollment in coaching institute

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Goa Village & Municipal Child Committee Grants And Awards Scheme
social_welfare_schemes.department: Department of Women and Child Development
objectives: Support Panchayats/Municipal bodies in addressing child-related issues
Promote child welfare activities at the local level

benefits.grant: ₹10,000 annually for administrative expenses, disbursed directly to Panchayat/Municipal body account

eligibility_criteria: Registered Panchayats or Municipal Local Bodies in Goa
Engaged in child welfare activities (e.g., education, health, protection)
Must submit annual report of activities
exclusions: Entities not engaged in child welfare activities

steps: Obtain application form from Department of Women and Child Development
Submit application with details of child welfare activities
Evaluation and approval by state authorities

documents_required: Bank account details of the body

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Fee Waiver Scheme For SC/ST Students Pursuing Higher Education
objectives: Provide free access to higher education for SC/ST students
Ensure no eligible SC/ST student is deprived of education due to financial constraints

benefits.fee_waiver: Full waiver of tuition fees for higher education, disbursed directly to educational institution

eligibility_criteria: Enrolled in recognized higher education institution in Goa
Family income not exceeding ₹3,00,000 per annum
exclusions: Students availing other fee waiver schemes

steps: Apply through educational institution or Department of Tribal Welfare
Verification by educational institution and authorities

documents_required: Proof of admission in higher education institution

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana
objectives: Provide life insurance cover for death due to any reason
Offer renewable one-year life insurance coverage

benefits.insurance_cover: ₹2,00,000 for death due to any reason, ₹436 per annum premium, disbursed to nominee’s bank account via DBT

eligibility_criteria: Must have a bank/post office account

steps: Approach participating bank or post office
Ensure sufficient balance for premium auto-debit

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Financial Assistance For Purchase Of Stationery To SC/ST/OBC/Minorities Students
social_welfare_schemes.department: Department for the Welfare of SC/ST/OBC/Minorities
objectives: Provide financial assistance for purchasing stationery
Support SC/ST/OBC/Minority students in classes 1 to 12

benefits.financial_assistance: ₹1,000–₹3,000 per year for stationery purchase, disbursed directly to student’s or parent’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Studying in Govt. of India/GNCT of Delhi/Aided Recognized schools
Family income not exceeding ₹2,00,000 per annum

steps: Obtain application form from school or Department for the Welfare of SC/ST/OBC/Minorities
Submit application with required documents through school
Verification by school and department authorities

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act
objectives: Provide at least 100 days of guaranteed wage employment
Support rural households with unskilled work opportunities

benefits.employment: Minimum 100 days of wage employment per financial year, wage rate varies by state (₹220–₹300 per day), disbursed directly to worker’s bank account via DBT

eligibility_criteria: Willing to do unskilled manual work
exclusions: Unwilling to perform unskilled manual work

steps: Apply at local Gram Panchayat for job card
Work assigned within 15 days of request

documents_required: Residence proof (e.g., ration card, voter ID)

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar Awas Navinikarn Yojna
social_welfare_schemes.department: Department of Social Justice and Empowerment
objectives: Provide grants for house repairs to Below Poverty Line families
Support Scheduled Caste and backward class families

benefits.grant: ₹80,000 for house repairs, disbursed directly to applicant’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Belong to Below Poverty Line, Scheduled Caste, or Backward Classes
exclusions: Families availing other housing repair schemes

steps: Submit application and note reference number

documents_required: Proof of house ownership (e.g., property deed)

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: The Artist Welfare Fund Of Assam
objectives: Provide financial assistance to artists
Support medical aid, education, and accident relief for artists

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to ₹50,000 for medical, educational, or accident-related expenses, disbursed directly to artist’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Recognized artist under the scheme (e.g., registered with cultural bodies)

steps: Obtain application form from Assam State Film (Finance and Development) Corporation
Submit application with details of financial need

documents_required: Proof of residence (e.g., voter ID, ration card)
Details of financial need (e.g., medical bills, educational expenses)

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: State Programme For Rehabilitation Of Persons With Disabilities
social_welfare_schemes.department: Department of Social Justice, Empowerment and Tribal Affairs
objectives: Provide rehabilitation services to persons with disabilities
Support under the Persons with Disabilities Act 1995

benefits.rehabilitation: Aids, appliances, and rehabilitation services, disbursed directly to service providers or applicant

eligibility_criteria: Person with disability as per the Persons with Disabilities Act 1995

steps: Obtain application form from Department of Social Justice

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Grant of House Construction Subsidy to Scheduled Caste People
objectives: Provide house construction subsidy to poor Scheduled Caste people
Support economically backward classes

benefits.subsidy: Up to ₹4,00,000 for house construction, disbursed directly to applicant’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Belong to Scheduled Caste or economically backward class
Family income not exceeding ₹2,00,000 per annum

steps: Obtain application form from Adi Dravidar Welfare Department

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Financial Assistance for Marriage of Poor Scheduled Caste Brides
objectives: Provide financial assistance for marriage of poor SC brides
Support poor Scheduled Caste parents

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to ₹50,000 for marriage expenses, disbursed directly to bride’s or parent’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Family income not exceeding ₹2,00,000 per annum

steps: Obtain application form from Adi Dravidar Welfare Department
Submit application with marriage invitation or proof

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Pension to the Persons who lost 100% Eye Sight
social_welfare_schemes.department: Directorate of Social Welfare and Social Education
objectives: Provide monthly pension to persons with 100% blindness
Support financial independence for visually impaired individuals

benefits.pension: ₹2,000 per month, disbursed directly to applicant’s bank account via DBT

steps: Obtain application form from Directorate of Social Welfare

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Leprosy Pension Scheme
social_welfare_schemes.department: Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities
objectives: Provide financial assistance to persons affected by leprosy
Support social welfare and empowerment

benefits.pension: ₹2,500 per month, disbursed directly to applicant’s bank account via DBT

eligibility_criteria: Diagnosed with leprosy by medical authority

steps: Obtain application form from Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Death Benefit Scheme (APB&OCWWB)
objectives: Provide financial assistance to families of deceased registered workers
Support construction workers' welfare

benefits.financial_assistance: ₹2,00,000 for death of registered worker, disbursed directly to family member’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Family member (spouse, child, or parent) applying post-worker’s death

steps: Obtain application form from APB&OCWWB office
Submit application with death certificate and documents

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: HIV / AIDS Pension Scheme
objectives: Provide monthly financial assistance to HIV/AIDS-affected persons
Support personal and medical expenses

benefits.pension: ₹1,500 per month, disbursed directly to applicant’s bank account via DBT

eligibility_criteria: Diagnosed with HIV/AIDS by medical authority

steps: Obtain application form from Department of Social Welfare

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: National Action Plan for Skill Development of Persons with Disabilities
social_welfare_schemes.ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
social_welfare_schemes.department: Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities
objectives: Provide vocational training to Persons with Disabilities (PwDs)
Enhance employability and societal contribution

benefits.training: High-quality vocational skill training at empanelled institutes, disbursed directly to training institutes

eligibility_criteria: Person with Disability as per government norms (Persons with Disabilities Act)

steps: Apply through designated training institutes or DEPwD portal at https://disabilityaffairs.gov.in/
Selection by training authorities based on merit/need

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Swasraya Scheme For Parents/Mothers Of Physically Handicapped/Mentally Retarded Persons
objectives: Provide financial assistance for self-employment
Support parents/mothers of physically/mentally disabled persons

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to ₹50,000 for self-employment ventures, disbursed directly to applicant’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Parent/mother of physically handicapped or mentally retarded person

steps: Obtain application form from Department of Social Justice
Submit application with business plan and documents

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Persons With Disabilities Scheme In Colleges: Financial Assistance To Visually Challenged Teachers
social_welfare_schemes.ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
social_welfare_schemes.department: Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities
objectives: Support visually challenged teachers in pursuing teaching and research
Provide financial assistance for readers and learning aids

benefits.readers_allowance: Up to ₹5,000 per month for hiring readers, disbursed directly to teacher’s bank account
benefits.learning_aids: Funds for Braille books and recorded materials, disbursed directly to teacher or supplier

eligibility_criteria: Certified visual impairment by medical authority

steps: Obtain application form from educational institution or DEPwD

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Farmer Suicide Ex-Gratia
objectives: Provide financial assistance to families of farmers who committed suicide
Support families affected by agrarian distress

benefits.ex_gratia: ₹7,00,000 to family members, disbursed directly to family member’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Family member of deceased farmer/tenant farmer
Suicide due to agrarian reasons (certified by authorities)

steps: Obtain application form from Agriculture & Cooperation Department
Submit application with death certificate and documents

documents_required: Proof of agrarian distress (e.g., loan documents, crop failure report)

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Rajasthan Chief Minister's Relief Fund - Accident Assistance
objectives: Provide financial assistance for accident victims
Support families in case of death or serious injury

benefits.death_assistance: ₹1,00,000 for death due to accident, disbursed directly to family member’s bank account
benefits.injury_assistance: Up to ₹20,000 for serious injury, disbursed directly to applicant’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Victim of accident or their family
Accident certified by police or medical authority

steps: Obtain application form from Chief Minister's Secretariat

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Supply of Prosthetic Appliances to Differently Abled Persons
objectives: Provide prosthetic appliances to differently-abled persons
Minimize mobility challenges

benefits.prosthetic_appliances: Free supply of prosthetic devices (e.g., wheelchairs, artificial limbs), disbursed directly to supplier or applicant

eligibility_criteria: Person with disability requiring prosthetic appliances

steps: Obtain application form from Department of Social Welfare

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: National Award For Senior Citizens (Vayoshreshtha Samman): Best District Panchayat In Providing Services And Facilities To Senior Citizens
social_welfare_schemes.ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
social_welfare_schemes.department: Department of Social Justice and Empowerment
objectives: Recognize district Panchayats for outstanding work for senior citizens
Promote services and facilities for senior citizens

benefits.award: Recognition by the President of India on 1st October annually, certificate and citation

eligibility_criteria: Demonstrated outstanding work for senior citizens (e.g., healthcare, social services)
Nominated by state government or self-nomination
exclusions: Panchayats without documented senior citizen welfare activities

steps: Nominate through Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
Submit details of senior citizen welfare activities

documents_required: Details of senior citizen welfare activities

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Annai Teresa Ninaivu Marriage Assistance Scheme for Orphan Girls-II
social_welfare_schemes.department: Social Welfare and Women Empowerment Department
objectives: Provide financial assistance for marriage of orphan girls
Support economically disadvantaged orphan brides

benefits.financial_assistance: ₹50,000 for marriage expenses, disbursed directly to bride’s bank account
benefits.gold: 8 grams of gold for mangalsutra, provided as physical gold or equivalent

eligibility_criteria: Orphan girl aged 18 years or older
Family income not exceeding ₹72,000 per annum

steps: Obtain application form from Social Welfare Department
Submit application with marriage invitation or proof

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Petrol Subsidy To Persons With Disability
objectives: Provide petrol/diesel subsidy for persons with disabilities
Support mobility for handicapped individuals using motorized vehicles

benefits.subsidy: 50% subsidy on petrol/diesel expenditure, up to ₹1,000 per month, disbursed directly to applicant’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Person with disability using motorized vehicle
exclusions: Vehicles not registered in applicant’s name

steps: Obtain application form from Department of Social Welfare
Submit application with disability certificate and vehicle details

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Shramyogi Home Town Scheme- Gujarat Labour Welfare Board
objectives: Facilitate railway fare payment for migrant labourers
Enable travel to/from home town for organized sector workers

benefits.travel_assistance: Full railway fare reimbursement for one round trip per year, disbursed directly to worker’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Migrant labourer in Gujarat’s organized sector
Registered with Gujarat Labour Welfare Board
Travel to/from home town within India

steps: Obtain application form from Gujarat Labour Welfare Board
Submit application with travel details and documents

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Laptop Purchase Assistance Scheme- Gujarat Labour Welfare Board
objectives: Provide financial assistance for laptop purchase
Support children of laborers in professional/design courses

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to ₹40,000 for laptop purchase, disbursed directly to applicant’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Child of registered laborer with Gujarat Labour Welfare Board
Enrolled in professional or design course (e.g., engineering, graphic design)
exclusions: Students not enrolled in professional/design courses
Applicants availing similar laptop assistance schemes

steps: Obtain application form from Gujarat Labour Welfare Board
Submit application with educational and labor registration documents

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Thatched House Repair Grant for Re-thatching & Repairs (Sainik Welfare)
objectives: Provide grants for re-thatching and repair of houses
Support ex-servicemen, widows, or dependents

benefits.grant: Up to ₹40,000 every three years, disbursed directly to applicant’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Own a thatched house requiring repairs
exclusions: Applicants not owning a thatched house

steps: Obtain application form from Department of Sainik Welfare
Submit application with house ownership proof

social_welfare_schemes.scheme_name: Financial Assistance for Purchase of Agricultural Land to Scheduled Caste Farmers
social_welfare_schemes.department: Department of Social Justice and Empowerment
objectives: Provide financial assistance for purchasing agricultural land
Support Scheduled Caste farmers for self-cultivation

benefits.financial_assistance: Up to ₹5,00,000 for purchasing up to 2 acres of land, disbursed directly to applicant’s bank account

eligibility_criteria: Farmer intending to purchase agricultural land
Not availing similar land purchase schemes
exclusions: Applicants availing other land purchase schemes

steps: Obtain application form from Department of Social Justice and Empowerment
Submit application with land purchase agreement
